VIII.iv.8.C.1.a
.
Convalescent Ratings Under 38 CFR 4.30
38 CFR 4.30
provides for a temporary 100-percent evaluation without regard to other provisions of the rating schedule if treatment of a service-connected (SC) disability resulted in
surgery necessitating at least one month convalescence
surgery with severe postoperative residuals, or
immobilization of at least one major joint by cast without surgery, including procedures performed at an outpatient clinic.
Note
:  The provision allowing assignment of a convalescent rating for outpatient surgery necessitating at least one-month of convalescence became effective March 1, 1989.
Reference
:  For more information on the statutory authority to assign a temporary disability rating based on convalescence, see
38 U.S.C. 1156(a)(1)(D)
.
